alert.note: Alert for Banner; Cheyenne; Kimball; Morrill (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 8:05PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Cheyenne, eastern Kimball, southwestern Morrill and southeastern Banner Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 705 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Kimball to 8 miles northwest of Westplains. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kimball, Potter, Dix and Kimball Airport. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 17 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
